lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Constructor to create a new CommandException.
super(String.format("Your task of %s requires the command %s", task, command));
* Constructor to create a new DescriptionException.
* @param task task which does not have a description.
super(String.format("The description of a %s cannot be empty.", task));
* Superclass of all exceptions that could be thrown by the Duke app.
* @param message error message to be shown.
* Exception when the command is invalid.
super("â˜¹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Exception when a done or delete command is followed by a number out of the list's range.
super("The number is either not in the list or your input after the done or delete command is not an Integer! (pls do that)");
* Method to split a string into an array, removing spaces.
* Writes current list to local storage's text file.
* Reads from local storage's text file.
* @return list containing Tasks stored in local storage.
System.out.println("Error: File path was provided as null.");
System.out.println("Error: File was not found in database.");
* Creates a text file if not present in local storage.
//should not occur since we are writing to local memory as opposed to network file
messages.displayText("Error: Unable to create txt file.");
* Deletes the text file from storage's directory.
* Creates a directory if not present in local storage.
messages.displayText("You currently do not have a directory to save the database. " +
messages.displayText("Error: Unable to create the directory.");
* Constructor to create a new Deadline object.
* @param description the description of the Deadline Task.
* @param by due date of Deadline Task.
* Retrieves the parameter by as a string.
* @param at date in which the event is to be held at.
* Gets the status of the current task object
* @return the string status where X means done and blank is not done
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks this task as done by changing the isDone boolean to true
* Retrieves the description of this task.
* @return the string description of the task.
* Constructor for a new Todo object.
* @param description description of the Todo Task.

private final Storage databaseEngine = new Storage();

private final String welcomeMessage = "Hello! I'm Duke\n" + "What can I do for you?";

String message = String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  %s", taskMarked);
* Message displayed when a task is deleted.
* @param taskString the task deleted from the list.
* @param listSize size of the task list after deletion.
public void taskDeleteMessage(String taskString, int listSize) {
String message = "Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + taskString + "\n";
message += String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", listSize);
* Message displayed when a task is added.

public void taskAddMessage(String taskString, int listSize) {

message += String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", listSize);
